Articles.Content:
OH YEAH! EXPERMENTING STAGE,GET READY,BECAUSE 0.20 IS RIGHT AROUND THE CORNER! WOOOOO!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/29551-New-Milestone-Reached!
This is for once, the only update I REALLY want, since these RAM issues haven haunted me since... 0.14 I think?
This is the part where they tell us the experimental stage takes an average of 2 weeks to finish...
Experiment,how about beta test?

Experiment,how about beta test?

Whoa there little guy! Getting a bit ahead of ourselves now are we? I think you'll remember that the game is still in Alpha, Beta comes later...
i mean the 0.20 test,remove beta.

Kerbal really needs to change how objects are called, rather than call all of them when starting the game. 85% of my RAM and 80% of my 4Gb Swap file are used when playing Kerbal. I love when a game actually makes use of what's available, but Kerbal uses it with stuff you aren't using

Kerbal really needs to change how objects are called, rather than call all of them when starting the game.

You'll be glad to know, then, that that's one of the changes coming in 0.20, barring last minute snags.
I haven't played KSP for about 1 or 2 months it will be fun to get back into it now that there is a new update
So close yet so far....

First time they actually announced the start of the experimental phase of an update and it was not accidental or something like that.

Nice !
So many spare time and they don't release on weekends. :-(
I give chance on Sunday, likes for 0.19

what is the flag ratio and resolution?

I can't wait to make my own flag:)
I can barely contain myself anymore, need to make some flags today so i am ready for .20 . I sure hope we don't have to wait 2 weeks^^
Can't wait. And here's hoping .21 finally then brings minerals/mining...
0.18 was in experimental phase for 2 or 3 weeks, why is everyone so happy?

Because with the Quality Assurance Team ironing out the major bugs before the Experimentals it is likely to come out sooner than 2 or 3 weeks.

The flags resolution is 256 x 160.

Edited May 18, 2013 by blspblackdeath
I'm expecting 0.20 to come out 9 days from this post.

'Two weeks.'Ã¢â€žÂ¢

(Trade marked by Joe Bender Enterprises)
How long does an experimental phase last on average? The suspense is killing me!

How long does an experimental phase last on average? The suspense is killing me!

If I recall correctly, the experimental builds are listed in the official changelog, so you could look in there if you want to have a look. It all depends on how difficult it is to find and squish the bugs that the testers discover.

This is for once, the only update I REALLY want, since these RAM issues haven haunted me since... 0.14 I think?

Yes. It was .14, and I will never forget it. I can not contain my excitement for this update :D

I can not contain my excitement for this update :D

That will be the first time Kerbals explode without a rocket.
Other than stockpiling mods for an interplanetary cruiser, I'm going to build a kerbal car with the new seats.
